block.p: American League YANKEES--Claimed OF-DH Jose Canseco off waivers from the Tampa Bay Devil Rays. Acquired INF Luis Sojo from the Pittsburgh Pirates for RHP Chris Spurling. Placed 2B Chuck Knoblauch on the 15-day disabled list, retroactive to Aug. 3. ANAHEIM ANGELS--Released RHP Ken Hill. BALTIMORE ORIOLES--Announced the extension of their working agreement with Rochester of the International League through 2002. DETROIT TIGERS--Placed RHP Hideo Nomo on the 15-day disabled list, retroactive to July 30. Activated RHP Danny Patterson from the 15-day disabled list. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Sent RHP Chad Durbin outright to Omaha of the PCL. Activated RHP Chris Fussell from the 15-day disabled list. TAMPA BAY DEVIL RAYS--Recalled OF Quinton McCracken from Durham of the International League. Assigned RHP Travis Harper to Durham. TEXAS RANGERS--Recalled RHP Darwin Cubillan from Oklahoma City of the PCL. Optioned RHP Francisco Cordero to Oklahoma City. TORONTO BLUE JAYS--Sent OF Rob Ducey to the Philadelphia Phillies to complete the Mickey Morandini trade of Aug. 6.

National League CINCINNATI REDS--Activated OF Brian Hunter. Designated OF Brooks Kieschnick for assignment. FLORIDA MARLINS--Signed INF-OF Casey Candaele to a minor league contract with Calgary of the PCL. PHILADELPHIA PHILLIES--Assigned INF David Newhan to Scranton-Wilkes Barre of the International League. Optioned C Gary Bennett to Scranton-Wilkes Barre. PITTSBURGH PIRATES--Activated OF Adrian Brown from the 15-day disabled list. SAN DIEGO PADRES--Claimed INF David Newhan off waivers and sent him to the Philadelphia Phillies to complete the Desi Relaford trade of Aug. 4. Agreed to terms with OF Eric Owens on a two-year contract extension.

BASKETBALL National Basketball Association CHICAGO BULLS--Named Norm Ellenberger assistant coach. GOLDEN STATE WARRIORS--Re-signed F/C Adonal Foyle. LOS ANGELES LAKERS--Announced the retirement of Jerry West, executive vice president of basketball operations. Named Mitch Kupchak executive vice president of basketball operations. Promoted Kurt Rambis to assistant general manager.

FOOTBALL National Football League JETS--Placed WR Matt Farmer on the reserve-military list. Placed DE Eric Ogbogu on injured reserve. BALTIMORE RAVENS--Signed RB Sam Gash to a one-year contract. CHICAGO BEARS--Signed K Jeff Jaeger. Released K Michael Husted. DENVER BRONCOS--Waived WR Chris Doering. Signed FB Ryan Christopherson. DETROIT LIONS--Signed S Leomont Evans. INDIANAPOLIS COLTS--Activated LB Cornelius Bennett from the physically-unable-to-perform list. Waived QB Gus Ornstein. PHILADELPHIA EAGLES--Released LB Dan Brandenburg.

HOCKEY National Hockey League RANGERS--Named Jason Lagnese manager of media relations and Linda Statkevicus premium seat coordinator. ANAHEIM MIGHTY DUCKS--Agreed to terms with D Patrick Traverse on a one-year contract. CAROLINA HURRICANES--Announced the resignation of Chris Brown, vice president of public relations-communications. COLUMBUS BLUE JACKETS--Signed D Sergei Kilmentiev and D Jonas Andersson-Junkka.

COLLEGE CORTLAND--Named Kory David linebackers coach, Steve Ellis running backs coach, Dan Rayome tight ends coach, Peter Rossomando offensive line coach, and Cary Marquell assistant head coach. DEFIANCE--Named Kary Zimmerman softball coach. FLORIDA ATLANTIC--Named Tasha Smith women's assistant basketball coach. IONA--Named Deb Reardon and Joanne Guzman women's assistant basketball coaches. JAMES MADISON--Named Mary Eggers Tendler women's assistant volleyball coach. LAFAYETTE--Named John Brown golf coach. MOLLOY--Named Dan Drutz sports information director. NEW JERSEY CITY--Named Jim Hague sports information director. RHODE ISLAND COLLEGE--Named Matt Coleman women's lacrosse coach. TUFTS--Named Ben Foster men's rowing coach.
